overview: Claude (Anthropic) and OpenAI Codex are now available in public preview as partner coding agents for Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise, usable across GitHub web, mobile, and VS Code to run agent sessions and delegate work.

detailed_explanation.title: What’s in public preview
bullets: Claude by Anthropic and OpenAI Codex can be selected as coding agents.
They are available to Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise customers during public preview.
Each coding agent session consumes one premium request during public preview.

detailed_explanation.title: Where you can start and manage sessions
bullets: Agent sessions can be started and assigned from github.com, GitHub Mobile, and VS Code.
Entry points include issues, pull requests, the Agents tab in enabled repositories, and the agent sessions view in VS Code.
You can follow progress in real time and review completed sessions from web and mobile session lists.

detailed_explanation.title: Enablement for Copilot Pro+
bullets: Go to Copilot coding agent settings.
Choose which repositories agents can access.
Enable Claude, Codex, or both using toggles.

detailed_explanation.title: Enablement for Copilot Enterprise
bullets: Enterprise admins must enable partner agents in Enterprise AI Controls (Agents tab → Partner Agents).
Org-level settings must also enable partner agents in the organization’s Copilot coding agent settings.
Specific role/permission requirements are Not stated in the article.

detailed_explanation.title: How agents participate in issues and pull requests
bullets: You can assign agents to issues via the Assignees dropdown; the agent can begin work and submit a draft pull request.
You can assign an open pull request to an agent and iterate via review feedback.
You can address agents in comments using @copilot, @claude, or @codex and use the session view for logs.

detailed_explanation.title: VS Code session types and prerequisites
bullets: VS Code 1.109 or later is required to use agent sessions from VS Code.
Session types include Local (fast interactive), Cloud (autonomous on GitHub), and Background (local; Copilot only).

key_changes: Claude and Codex are available as partner coding agents (public preview) for Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise.
Agents can be used across GitHub web, GitHub Mobile, and VS Code with shared session visibility.
Agent sessions consume premium requests during public preview.
impact: Copilot customers can choose different agent providers for tasks like implementing changes, iterating on PR feedback, and drafting pull requests.
Enterprise admins gain new configuration responsibilities to enable/limit partner agents at enterprise and org levels.
Teams may need to account for premium-request consumption when using agent sessions during preview.
caveats: The feature is in public preview.
Each coding agent session consumes one premium request during public preview.
Background sessions in VS Code are Copilot-only (not available for Claude/Codex).
insights: The article stresses cross-client continuity (web, mobile, IDE) as a core part of the partner-agent experience.
Enablement instructions are detailed, implying governance and controlled rollout are important, especially for enterprises.
